citeinfo.origin: U.S. Census Bureau and Metropolitan Council
citeinfo.title: Transportation Analysis Zones for External Counties

descript.abstract: Transportation analysis zones are subdivisions of geographical areas that are delineated for land use and travel analysis purposes. This dataset covers 13 counties outside of the seven Twin Cities metro counties. They are the Minnesota counties of Chisago, Goodhue, Isanti, Le Sueur, Mc Leod, Mille Lacs, Rice, Sherburne, Sibley and Wright; and the Wisconsin counties of Pierce, Polk and St. Croix.
descript.purpose: The transportation analysis zones layer was developed as a means to compile, analyze and exhibit demographic data and data related to capacity to produce travel. The primary analysis is the magnitude of tripmaking created within each TAZ and the interaction of these trips between the various zones within the region.
descript.supplinf: Ten Minnesota counties and three Wisconsin counties bordering the seven Twin Cities metro counties.

theme.themekey: Transportation Analysis Zones, Population, Households, Traffic Assignment Zones, Traffic Analysis Zones, External Stations, Collar Counties, transportation, demographics

citeinfo.title: Transportation Analysis Zones for the seven county metro area http://www.datafinder.org/metadata/TAZ2000.htm

attracc.attraccr: No test have been made related to attribute accuracy.

dataqual.complete: The line work for all thirteen counties is complete.

horizpa.horizpar: The positional accuracy of the dataset has not been tested under the National Standards for Spatial Data Accuracy. The positional accuracy of the dataset is UNKNOWN.

procstep.procdesc:
The linework comes from Tiger data received in 1999. Metropolitan Council projected to UTM, NAD83 Meters and combined counties. Then TAZ IDs were added by Metropolitan Council staff.
In December 2003, attributes for population and households were added. This attribute data was from the US Census Transportation Planning Package (CTPP) part 1.

overview.eaover:
POLYGON ATTRIBUTES:
COUNTY: The two digit FIPS state code appended to the three digit FIPS county code. This provides a unique county code across state boundaries.
TAZ_2000: The unique identifier for each zone.
POP_2000: Population for the TAZ from the 2000 US Census Transportation Planning Package (CTPP).
HH_2000: Households for the TAZ from the 2000 CTPP.

The Metropolitan Council does not represent or warrant that the GIS Data or the data documentation are error-free, complete, current, or accurate. You are responsible for any consequences resulting from your use of the GIS Data or your reliance on the GIS Data. You should consult the data documentation for this particular GIS Data to determine the limitations of the GIS Data and the precision with which the GIS Data may depict distance, direction, location, or other geographic features. If you transmit or provide the GIS Data (or any portion of it) to another user, it is recommended that the GIS Data include a copy of this disclaimer and this metadata.

stdorder.ordering:
This dataset is distributed on the internet by clicking below after 'Online Linkage'. Doing so will tell your browser to download a 'ZIP' file which will contain the following:
- ArcView shape files - metadata for the dataset (.htm and .xml) - NOTICE.RTF, an important notice about this dataset that can be read by any word processing software.
Additionally, this dataset is available for direct use via one or more map services. More information about what a web mapping service is can be found at http://www.datafinder.org/services/. The specific map service and layer name for this dataset can be found by clicking the blue or green boxes under the map service column of the DataFinder Catalog at http://www.datafinder.org/catalog/ .
